statement:
Let $F$ be a finite field of characteristic $p$, and let $f$ and $g$ be
distinct monic irreducible (non-constant) polynomials in the polynomial
ring $F[X]$. Define the [*Legendre symbol*]{} $\left(\frac{f}{g}\right)$
by $$\left(\frac{f}{g}\right) :=
\begin{cases}
1 & \text{ if $f$ is a square in the quotient ring $F[X]/(g)$,} \\
-1 & \text{ otherwise.}
\end{cases}$$ The quadratic reciprocity theorem for polynomials over a
finite field states that
$$\left(\frac{f}{g}\right) \left(\frac{g}{f}\right) = (-1)^{\frac{p-1}{2} \deg(f) \deg(g)}.$$

[9]{} Feng, Ke Qin and Ying, Linsheng, [*An elementary proof of the law
of quadratic reciprocity in $F\sb q(T)$.*]{} Sichuan Daxue Xuebao
[**26**]{} (1989), Special Issue, 36–40. Merrill, Kathy D. and Walling,
Lynne H., [*On quadratic reciprocity over function fields.*]{} Pacific
J. Math. [**173**]{} (1996), no. 1, 147–150.
